thread.title: GM agrees to provide $3.6 billion funding to South Korean unit: South Korea

title: GM agrees to provide $3.6 billion funding to South Korean unit: South Korea
text:
April 26, 2018 / 11:18 AM / Updated 27 minutes ago GM agrees to provide $3.6 billion funding to South Korean unit: South Korea Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
SEOUL (Reuters) - General Motors has agreed to provide $3.6 billion in fresh funding to its troubled South Korean unit, higher than its previously proposed $2.3 billion as part of a preliminary deal, South Korea said on Thursday. The GM logo is seen at the General Motors headquarters in Sao Caetano do Sul, Brazil March 13, 2018. Picture taken March 13, 2018. REUTERS/Leonardo Benassatto/Files
State-funded Korea Development Bank also said the U.S. automaker agreed to swap all of the debt owed by its South Korean unit to the headquarters into equity.
The KDB, which owns a 17 percent stake in GM Korea, also plans to invest a total of $750 billion in the unit. Reporting by Hyunjoo Jin and Ju-min Park; editing by Jason Neely
